cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest and then north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, with the core expected to cross the TX/LA border near Sabine Pass tonight and then accelerate northward inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Sabine Pass / Sea Rim State Park TX – Johnson Bayou LA area (TX-LA border, just south of Beaumont-Port Arthur)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (Storm Surge Warning also in effect)
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in immediate area (Hurricane Watch is east of Intracoastal City LA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning: Freeport TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (includes Sea Rim State Park, Sabine Lake)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline from Freeport TX eastward to Intracoastal City LA, including Sabine and Calcasieu Lakes
weather_observation.wind: Catastrophic, potentially hurricane-force winds (gusts >100 mph) possible as the eyewall tracks just east of Beaumont
weather_observation.storm_surge: 10–15 ft inundation possible in Sabine Lake and along the Sabine-Neches Waterway, pushing water well inland toward Beaumont
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches, causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, life-threatening surf/rip currents, and possible river flooding from heavy rain
